title: Boxlet Storage
description: Founded an Airbnb-like peer-to-peer storage network at Cal & UCLA, attracting 200+ bookings over summer and $10k+ in revenue. Created API for Boxlet, enabling cross-platform functionality between iOS, Android, and web users, doubling bookings and users. Solidified competitive price points by writing web scripts to scrape 200+ storage facility sites and benchmark their cost/sq. foot.
business_skills: Customer Discovery & Interviews, Marketing Strategy, Competitive Analysis, Ad Campaigns, Marketing Collateral Design, Customer Support,
technical_skills: HTML, CSS, JS, Node.JS, Google APIs, FB APIs, Stripe API, Heroku, Firebase, Business Process Automation

title: MDB
description: Designed, developed, and deployed an iOS app connecting influencers to eventgoers under a $50,000 contract for high-growth startup. Led team of 6 developers to deliver over 120 app features by enforcing AGILE development sprints, increasing sprint velocity by 70% Developed & taught 80-hour iOS development and user research curriculum to 17 students driving 95% freshman job placement rate
business_skills: Leadership, Product Management, Engineering Management, Negotiation, Go-To-Market Strategy
technical_skills: Swift, Front-End Web, Node.JS, Server Daemons and Chrons

title: Sage Intacct
description: Recommended 5-year core product roadmap bringing in $25mn/year by conducting sentiment analysis; After analyzing over 700 escalations and bucketing customer needs into top 8 themes, prioritized most pressing features with customer survey, 200+ responses. Led team of 3 engineers to query 11 key usage metrics from customer database; Utilized metrics to design 3 user experiences, define and design 2 UI components, identify 2 critical product needs surfaced by 60+ customer workarounds, and rank feature importance. Coordinated product teams to architect the beta release of an accounting ledger anomaly detection AI by defining its 8 subprocesses

title: Sage Intacct
description: Increased average call connect rate of 38 telemarketers from 5% to 12% by developing OpptyCall, a descriptive & prescriptive artificial intelligence that customizes telemarketer calling schedules. Reduced annual lead prospecting costs by $150K and improved lead quality by 23% by building a lead-qualification machine learning model. Increased opportunity production by 167% by (1) identifying lead-scoring changes that incorrectly prioritized leads, (2) identifying underperforming PPL vendors by vertical, (3) proposing telemarketer hiring schedules based on attrition and productivity curves

title: Ishan4Senate
description: Senate Campaign running on three platforms: Improving transportation on campus, increasing accessibilty of resources for start-ups, and creating more opportunities for professional development. Led much of the creative process automated email farming to amass over 400 votes.

title: Market Games
description: Berkeley-Haas start-up providing business simulation games for higher education. Tested product in business simulations, as well as performed research on higher education institutions through speaking with department heads in order to better design and tailor web-based content.

title: Illumix
description: Illumix provides augmented reality tech as a gaming studio to bring fandom worlds to life by partnering with the relevant IP owners. Increased recruiting awareness by designing 15+ design assets for a recruiting fair and developed additional assets for the landing page. Finalized company logo amongst 18 different propositions.

title: Lightspeed
description: Won a $65,000 grant from Lightspeed to build an Amazon Alexa-based assistant for dementia patients to remember their medication. Increased market segment awareness by generating 35+ hours of customer interviews and 200 reviews through marketing strategies. Managed product development using customer interviews to optimize and add 14 features utilizing HTML/CSS, Node.JS/JS skills. Worked with UCSF and QB3 to obtain Institutional Review Board backing and enable usage of product within assisted living facilities.

title: Intero
description: Sold $5.25mn worth of houses around the Bay Area in a 2-year period after studying for and attaining license in October of 2016. Cut offer closing period by 25% over industry average (28-day close) by leveraging my network of escrow, lending, & insurance agents. Maintained 100% callback rate for submitted client offers by pricing accurately using weighted regression on 1k+ similar transactions. Sourced over 180 contacts and 14 qualified leads by strategically posting 2000+ flyers and talking to clients at 15+ community events

title: AGF
description: As a Vote Everywhere Ambassador of the Andrew Goodman Foundation, I worked to host California Secretary of State Alex Padilla, to speak on the importance of voter registration to over 400 students. I also arranged for ballot boxes at Cal and obtained NSLVE enrollment for the school. Registered 200+ students for the 2016 election.

title: Azaad
description: UC Berkeley Azaad is Berkeley's nationally-ranked collegiate fusion dance team. Raised over $30k with 100+ cold emails to fund national trips by fielding performances at 40+ weddings, marathons, and birthdays. Choreographed 15-foot basket toss of teammate and human helicopter maneuver to win national championships among 70+ teams. Supported team of 26 by planning 7-day dance camp to develop camaraderie; Achieved record 10% churn through year of captainship
technical_skills: Final Cut Pro, Motion, Excel, Adobe Audition

title: Free Ventures
description: Berkeley-based accelerator program located at The House providing students with the resources to grow their ideas and innovate. I attended weekly networking sessions with professionals in the technology and medical sectors for industry perspective as a part of Memory Labs. Fine-tuned the craft of creating pitch decks with program coordinators with over 40 hours of decking, and ended up pitching to VC firms, including Grelock Partners, Sequoia, and KPCB.

title: ASUC Offices
description: I was a part of both Senator Chris Yamas' office, as well as the Financial Wellness Commission. During my time, I worked on an ASUC transfer student amendment which would increase their representation in student government. Additionally, I wrote, lobbied, and got a bill passed that would require that incoming students complete a basic financial literacy module.

title: Peer Court
description: Justice program with County’s Probation Department working to process dispositional hearings for minors guilty of misdemeanors. Helped 15+ minors restore themselves and community. Met with offenders/victims to obtain mitigatory/exacerbating circumstances not in the JCR. Determined interventions best suited to stop crime pattern development through restorative justice. Drafted and conducted opening/closing statements, direct/cross exams before a jury of peers and a Superior Court Judge.
